Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the impact of the 2011-13 state budget by stating that it eliminates the structural deficit "for the first time in decades." This suggests that the budget has completely resolved the underlying problems, which may be an exaggeration.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the 2011-13 state budget has eliminated the structural deficit, without providing enough evidence or support for this assumption.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide enough evidence or support to back up the assertion that the budget eliminates the structural deficit.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations or factors that may have contributed to the elimination of the structural deficit, such as one-time maneuvers or external factors.
